title: Azure DevOps Pipeline Dashboard
vision: Build an Azure DevOps Pipeline dashboard page that gives engineering teams a fast operational view of pipeline health, run trends, stage performance, and agent capacity.
problem: Teams lack a single at-a-glance Azure-style dashboard to monitor failing pipelines, run durations, flaky behavior, and agent pool saturation, which slows triage and release decisions.
successCriteria: Shows pipeline health summary with pass/fail/in-progress counts and overall success-rate donut visualization
Includes recent pipeline runs timeline with duration bars, status indicators, and commit message context
Provides a Slowest Stages panel ranking longest-running pipeline stages with average durations
Displays build agent pool utilization with online/offline/busy counts and utilization context
Surfaces an alert banner for pipelines failing continuously for over 24 hours
Includes Copilot suggestion prompts for failure diagnosis and flaky test investigation
nonGoals: No live Azure DevOps API integration in this prototype
No deep drill-in to individual pipeline definition pages
constraints: Use Coherence components and design tokens
Use realistic mock data for pipelines, runs, stages, and agents
